1.text: Better is the poor who walks in his integrity than he who is perverse in his lips and is a fool.

2.text: It isn’t good to have zeal without knowledge; nor being hasty with one’s feet and missing the way.

3.text: The foolishness of man subverts his way; his heart rages against Yahweh.

4.text: Wealth adds many friends, but the poor is separated from his friend.

5.text: A false witness shall not be unpunished. He who pours out lies shall not go free.

6.text: Many will entreat the favor of a ruler, and everyone is a friend to a man who gives gifts.

7.text: All the relatives of the poor shun him: how much more do his friends avoid him! He pursues them with pleas, but they are gone.

8.text: He who gets wisdom loves his own soul. He who keeps understanding shall find good.

9.text: A false witness shall not be unpunished. He who utters lies shall perish.

10.text: Delicate living is not appropriate for a fool, much less for a servant to have rule over princes.

11.text: The discretion of a man makes him slow to anger. It is his glory to overlook an offense.

12.text: The king’s wrath is like the roaring of a lion, but his favor is like dew on the grass.

13.text: A foolish son is the calamity of his father. A wife’s quarrels are a continual dripping.

14.text: House and riches are an inheritance from fathers, but a prudent wife is from Yahweh.

15.text: Slothfulness casts into a deep sleep. The idle soul shall suffer hunger.

16.text: He who keeps the commandment keeps his soul, but he who is contemptuous in his ways shall die.

17.text: He who has pity on the poor lends to Yahweh; he will reward him.

18.text: Discipline your son, for there is hope; don’t be a willing party to his death.

19.text: A hot-tempered man must pay the penalty, for if you rescue him, you must do it again.

20.text: Listen to counsel and receive instruction, that you may be wise in your latter end.

21.text: There are many plans in a man’s heart, but Yahweh’s counsel will prevail.

22.text: That which makes a man to be desired is his kindness. A poor man is better than a liar.

23.text: The fear of Yahweh leads to life, then contentment; he rests and will not be touched by trouble.

24.text: The sluggard buries his hand in the dish; he will not so much as bring it to his mouth again.

25.text: Flog a scoffer, and the simple will learn prudence; rebuke one who has understanding, and he will gain knowledge.

26.text: He who robs his father and drives away his mother, is a son who causes shame and brings reproach.

27.text: If you stop listening to instruction, my son, you will stray from the words of knowledge.

28.text: A corrupt witness mocks justice, and the mouth of the wicked gulps down iniquity.

29.text: Penalties are prepared for scoffers, and beatings for the backs of fools.
